channel.title: Celestial Soda Pop by Ray Lynch
channel.description: https://app.auxy.co/projects/TEThkTuVhUWxNjrwgMUSFw== my cover of celestial soda pop by Ray Lynch. I didn't get a chance to finish. I couldn't find a good enough sound for a theremin. Can anyone help me out with that ?

item.title: Celestial Soda Pop by Ray Lynch
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
Yep. I mispoke/mistyped.
Meant that the vibrato would be the volume.

Built the sentence in pieces (interspersed with viewing a theremin vid) and didn’t edit it properly before adding it.

My bad.

Read full topic
item.source: Celestial Soda Pop by Ray Lynch

item.title: Celestial Soda Pop by Ray Lynch
item.dc:creator: Trey
item.description:
Vibrato actually doesn’t have anything to do with pitch if done correctly. I would think more of slight volume and/or low pass to make it.

Read full topic
item.source: Celestial Soda Pop by Ray Lynch

item.title: Celestial Soda Pop by Ray Lynch
item.dc:creator: CounterC1ockwise
item.description:
I think bow is as close as it’s going to get, but I’ll keep experimenting.

Read full topic
item.source: Celestial Soda Pop by Ray Lynch

item.title: Celestial Soda Pop by Ray Lynch
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
SpaghettiSauce:

A theremin sound might be achieved by doing lowpass automation on “bow”, depending on how much vibrato you want.

I don’t think filtering will get you there.
Theremin is all about volume and that characteristic vibrato and glissando, both of which would be handled through pitch automation.

Read full topic
item.source: Celestial Soda Pop by Ray Lynch

item.title: Celestial Soda Pop by Ray Lynch
item.dc:creator: BlutoothCutthroat
item.description:
Ok, duh, you’re not Ray. See how easily I confuse?

Read full topic
item.source: Celestial Soda Pop by Ray Lynch

item.title: Celestial Soda Pop by Ray Lynch
item.dc:creator: BlutoothCutthroat
item.description:
Ray- noob BTCT here. I’m just getting my ears wet with what you Auxians are doing and I had no idea! Not familiar with the source material but this is an amazing piece, impeccably produced, lush and gorgeous. Who needs a theremin! I’m just a noodler so I need to do some studying of this work and likely many others. Great work!

Read full topic
item.source: Celestial Soda Pop by Ray Lynch
